summary: Claude Plan Creation: Detailed Implementation Process

content.text:
# PR Creation Command

Create a pull request with proper formatting and description.

Title:
- The title needs to follow semantic versioning.
- The title needs to be a single line.
- The title needs to be a short description of the changes.
- The title needs to be a single line.

## Usage
```bash
gh pr create --title "{{TITLE}}" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Description

This PR aims to (replace with a short description of the changes).

**FEATURES**
- [bullet point]

**FIXES**
- [bullet point]

**BREAKING CHANGES**
- [bullet point]

## Test Plan

EOF
)"
```

## Description
This command creates a GitHub pull request using the `gh` CLI tool with:
- A descriptive title
- A formatted body using a heredoc for proper multiline handling
- Template placeholder for consistent PR descriptions

If $ARGUMENTS is provided, follow the instructions in the arguments.

summary: CLI Deprecation & App Deletion Changelog Update

content.text: I'll create a pull request for the current branch `feat-add-login-link`. Let me first check the current state and recent changes to understand what this PR includes.

input.description: Show all changes from main branch

content.content:
On branch feat-add-login-link
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/feat-add-login-link'.

nothing to commit, working tree clean

toolUseResult.stdout:
On branch feat-add-login-link
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/feat-add-login-link'.

nothing to commit, working tree clean

content.text: Now I'll create the pull request with the proper formatting:

input.command:
gh pr create --title "feat: add login link to header navigation" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Description

This PR adds a login link to the header navigation for unauthenticated users and creates a reusable AppLink component for consistent link styling.

**FEATURES**
- Add login link in header for unauthenticated users
- Create reusable AppLink component with internal/external link variants
- Replace hardcoded blog link with AppLink component for consistency
- Conditional rendering: show UserButton for authenticated users, login link for unauthenticated users

**FIXES**
- Improved navigation UX by providing clear login action for unauthenticated users

**BREAKING CHANGES**
- None

## Test Plan

- [ ] Verify login link appears for unauthenticated users
- [ ] Verify UserButton appears for authenticated users  
- [ ] Test login link redirects to Stack Auth sign-in page
- [ ] Verify blog link still works with new AppLink component
- [ ] Test responsive behavior on mobile devices

EOF
)"
input.description: Create pull request with formatted description

content.text:
